column4: can anyone explain why when I booted recovery mode to root my HDMI output started working? Previously, a 'normal' reboot would not get it working.
I can't explain that, but I have problems with HDMI too
if you type aplay -l in terminal, what's the output?
Intel [HDA Intel], device 0: STAC92xx Analog [STAC92xx Analog].
to me it seems that HDMI isn't detected, I would expect a device named something with "HDMI" to be listed
what bothers me is that I can't yet get a consistent way to get HDMI to work. Plus Vista would not work today either.
It is working right now. At least my wallpaper is showing on the HD TV
Oops, missed this line - card 0: Intel [HDA Intel], device 3: INTEL HDMI [INTEL HDMI]
That's the one I was hoping for
try 'aplay -D plughw:0,3 <anywavfile>.wav'
Yes, it is playing out the TV speakers. But, I don't trust that it will work in the future.
You have to add that output as your default, by editing /etc/asound.conf, look at the last part of http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=6690552&postcount=4
that will take care of the video as well?
That's for sound, sry, didn't see you have video problems as well
I guess you have had a look at display settings under system prefs?
that's Ok. I'm happy to learn how to manage my machines

the display preferences is always an accurate representation of what ubuntu thinks is available. But, sadly, even when connected to TV is often (well mostly now) fails to see it. I'd like to know a way to force it to see the external monitor.
I don't know how to force detection, but since Vista also sometimes fails, I suspect hw issue. Pls hilight me if you solve it, would love to see the solution
The Dell tech thinks it is software! And he doesn't want to get rid of Vista (which I plan to today) as they don't support Ubuntu here.
Odd. Well, have dell help you rule out hw issues before removing vista
That would make sense but they have no testing facilities here. The best I could do is find a friend with an HDMI monitor/TV and I don't know of any. or at my workplace or my partners.
Dell can't rule out hardware issues. The only option they can provide is giving me a refurbished mother board (which I don't want).
thx for support. I must go join the family.
gl with motherboard and family L:)
